subject: Real Estate
title: Loss Aversion and Sticky Sellers
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Loss Aversion and Sticky Sellers.

hook.text: Losing $100 feels twice as painful as gaining $100 feels good. This asymmetry warps property markets.

buildup.text: Sellers who face a loss on their home pull it off the market rather than accept the emotional pain.

discovery.text: This is why housing markets freeze in downturns. Volume crashes as sellers refuse to sell at a loss.

twist.text: Paradoxically, holding on often makes it worse. Markets keep falling while sellers wait for recovery.

climax.text: Loss aversion makes housing crashes slower and longer than they need to be. Nobody wants to go first.

punchline.text: Sellers would rather wait forever than lose a dollar.

quiz.question: How does loss aversion affect housing markets during downturns?
options: Sellers refuse to sell, freezing the market
